intro: Brodiaea matsonii, commonly known as the Matson's brodiaea, is a perennial flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale purple flowers during the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal scrub and grassland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
